event.name: ROCK_NEEDSMISSILES
event.text: You're hailed by a Rock vessel, who is supposedly low on missiles. They offer to buy some from you.

choice.text: We aren't interested in selling anything.

event.text: You apologize and continue on your way.

event.name: ROCK_APOLOGY
event.text: Moments after entering the system, you receive a message from the nearby ship; "We are sinners! Oh woe is us! Strike us down! Punish us! We do not deserve the gift of life!"
The Rockman's pleading continues for some time, but you simply tune them out and fly away.

"I have SINNED! I... used the restroom... and I was out of toilet paper... and I had a holy script nearby and... OH GOD! I'm a MONSTER! How could you make me relive my crimes? You are cruel! Too cruel for this world! First I will kill you, then myself!"

"I have SINNED! I... used the restroom... and I was out of toilet paper... and I had a holy script nearby and... OH GOD! I'm a MONSTER! Oh please, allow me to redeem myself! In any way I can, perhaps there are favors I can serve to find my way to heaven once more!"
"I have changed my mind! I no longer wish to die! I shall redeem myself by killing you instead!"
"Oh thank you good captain! Only in death shall I find redemption!"

event.name: ROCK_PUNS
event.text: A stoic Rock Captain hails you. "Federation. I have an important question for you. Why can you not expect perfection from geologists?"
"Because they all have their FAULTS!" He breaks into intense laughter.
Your laughter mixes together with the Rockman. After a while, you both calm down. So grateful that you found humor in his pun, the Rockman feels compelled to gift you some missiles!
"Wait... Wait no, it was just a joke!"
The Rockman is so impressed by the retaliation of your own pun that he submits, promising to dedicate the rest of his existence to your servitude. As long as he can keep making puns along the way.
The Rockman is so impressed by the retaliation of your own pun that he submits, promising to dedicate the rest of his existence to your servitude. As long as he can keep making puns along the way.
"Is that supposed to be a pun? I cannot tell if you are insulting me or making a pitiful attempt to join me. I hate Leeches. Get out of my sight!"

choice.text: (Slug Crew) Have your Slug predict the answer.

event.text: Your Slug grumbles. "It'ssss jussst a ssstupid pun." Your Slug repeats the answer to the Rockmen. "Because they all have faultssss..." The Rockman frowns that you predicted it, and turns off transmissions.

choice.text: (Telepathic Shell) Have your Shell predict the answer.

event.text: Your Shell scoffs. "Thhhis is an incredibly unendearing attempt of... comedy." Your Shell repeats the answer to the Rockmen. "Because thhhey all have faults..." The Rockman laughs upon hearing it, unaware that your Shell got the answer off his mind. He feels compelled to gift you some missiles for taking part in his antics.

event.name: ROCK_CRYOBSESSION
event.text: A nearby Rock settlement, painted almost entirely light blue, hails you. "You are from the outside? You wouldn't happen to have anything originating from the Crystal race, would you?"

choice.text: (Crystalline Weapon) We have a Crystal weapon.

event.text: "Amazing! Such a well crafted weapon too. I don't suppose you'd be willing to sell us one, would you?"

choice.text: Sell them a Crystal Burst MK I.
Sell them an Elite Crystal Burst MK I.
Sell them a Crystal Burst MK II.
Sell them an Elite Crystal Burst MK II.
Sell them a Heavy Crystal MK I.
Sell them an Elite Heavy Crystal MK I.
Sell them a Heavy Crystal MK II.
Sell them an Elite Heavy Crystal MK II.
Sell them an Elite Crystal Scatter.
Sell them an Elite Crystal Charger.
Sell them an Elite Neural Crystal.
Sell them a Chaotic Amber Launcher.
We aren't interested in selling anything.

event.text: "Ah... what a shame. Oh well, you must know that you are very lucky to wield such exotic tech!"

choice.text: (Crystal Crew) We have a Crystal aboard our ship.

event.text: The Rockman goes silent. Then, in a shaky tone, he says, "You... you must be gods! Please, take everything we have!"
The settlement immediately cuts transmissions.

event.name: ROCK_PROPHECY
event.text: A ship carrying several robed Rockmen carrying holy books and candles hails you. "A time of change is coming! Have you heard the news? The prophecy, it shall be fulfilled!"

"Have you not heard? The ship from a future much brighter than ours, who will bring about a great change! A gift from the high heavens, bestowed upon us mortal-bound men by the benevolent Crystal ones!"

choice.text: Could we be the ship from the prophecy?

event.text: One of the Rockmen pull down their cloak and stare for a long time deep into your eyes. "I am no expert, but you have the look of a creature driven by a force beyond your control. Your will is bent by a being from the great beyond, manipulated for the simple sake of amusement. If you are not the one spoken of in the prophecy, then surely you are important regardless. Perhaps this may be of aid."

choice.text: These people are crazy, let's leave.

event.text: You have better things to than listen to the ravings of these religious loons.

event.name: ROCK_TEMPLE
event.text: Nearby rests a Rockman temple dedicated to the Crystal race. A thick fog covers the planet and it's hard to see if there's anything protecting the shrine.
You'd have to be insane to raid a Rockman temple in Rock territory.
While attempting to rob the temple, you are stopped by a Rock vessel, who immediately attacks!
Inside the temple you find some supplies and a Crystal weapon.

event.name: ASTEROID_DERELICT_SHIP
event.text: A ship without life forms within a nearby dense asteroid field is giving off the distress call. Shall we investigate? It could be dangerous.
Discretion is the better part of valor. Better not risk it.

choice.text: (Rock Plating) Make a thorough search for the ship without fear of stray asteroids.

event.text: You find what appears to be pieces of a derelict Crystal station. Before you have a chance to dock, a few asteroids get past your shields and partially damage your engines. You'll have to pull out!
You find a pirate ship, damaged and abandoned. You salvage what you can and move on.
You find the decaying remains of a derelict Crystalline station. There's a weird sense of deja vu, and in the corner is a stasis pod and a Crystal weapon.
It looks like a massive asteroid is in a direct collision course with the station! You have to pull your crew out but they want to grab what they can first. What do they take?

choice.text: Take the weapon and any spare resources.

event.text: Your crew grabs what they can and returns to the ship before the asteroid hits. You take a look at what you've recovered once you move clear of the asteroid field.
Your crew drags the pod back to your ship before the asteroid smashes into the station, shattering through the crystal coating.

You're able to activate the stasis chamber once again and find the Crystal inside still alive. They're confused and wondering what year it is, so you give them a very simple explanation as to your current situation and hurry to leave the asteroid field.
You find the decaying remains of a derelict Crystalline station. There's a weird sense of deja vu, and in the corner is a stasis pod and a Crystal weapon.
It looks like a massive asteroid is in a direct collision course with the station! You have to pull your crew out but they want to grab what they can first. What do they take?

choice.text: Take the weapon and any spare resources.

event.text: Your crew grabs what they can and returns to the ship before the asteroid hits. You take a look at what you've recovered once you move clear of the asteroid field.
Your crew drags the pod back to your ship before the asteroid smashes into the station, shattering through the crystal coating.

You're able to activate the stasis chamber once again and find the Crystal inside still alive. They're confused and wondering what year it is, so you give them a very simple explanation as to your current situation and hurry to leave the asteroid field.

event.name: ROCK_WEAPON_MEASURING
event.text: "Hah! Look at your wee little ship! I bet your weapons are tiny! You must be so ashamed."

choice.text: The hell did you just say to us?

event.text: The Rockman arrogantly chuckles as you prepare to fight them.
"Hah! You call that big weapons? Your brain must be even smaller!"
"Getting warmer, but that's still nothing compared to what we have!"
"Hmmm, not bad. Not many ships come here packing such heat. I'm sure a ship like yours will find a use for a powerful weapon like this!"

choice.text: (Lvl 8 Weapons) Oh, we can do better than that.

event.text: "Well now you're just showing off. I like it. I wish to sample your arsenal. I shall join you!"
"Hah! You call that big weapons? Your brain must be even smaller!"
"Getting warmer, but that's still nothing compared to what we have!"
"Hmmm, not bad. Not many ships come here packing such heat. I'm sure a ship like yours will find a use for a powerful weapon like this!"

choice.text: (Lvl 4 Artillery) Oh, we can do better than that.

event.text: "Well now you're just showing off. I like it. I wish to sample your arsenal. I shall join you!"
"Well now you're just showing off. I like it. I wish to sample your arsenal. I shall join you!"
You ignore the egotistical Rockmen and continue on your way.

event.name: SURRENDER_ROCK_BIGGUNS
event.text: "Jeez man, we've heard it's not about the size but how you use it, and you sure know how to use your guns! You've proven your point, let us go and we'll pay you some ammunition to fuel those guns of yours."

event.name: ROCK_LOOTING_MV
event.text: You find a disabled Rock transport floating near the beacon. You consider stripping it of useful parts but are uncertain why it's there in the first place.

choice.text: (Slug Crew) Check for lifeforms and keep a lookout for ships while looting the wreck.
(Telepathic Shell) Check for lifeforms and keep a lookout for ships while looting the wreck.

event.text: You salvage what you can from the ship. No one bothers you during the operation.
A Rock patrol ship jumps in while you are salvaging the ship. They message you, "Filthy pirates! Prepare to die!" You doubt explaining your mission will convince them of your need.
The Rock people are not known for setting traps but you hasten to leave anyway.
The Rock people are not known for setting traps but you hasten to leave anyway.

Before you have a chance to leave, a Rock patrol ship arrives and you intercept their comm chatter, "...appears we've finally found them. Their killing spree ends now!" Before you can plead your innocence they move in to attack.
You salvage what you can from the ship. No lifeforms or ships are detected nearby.
You begin the salvage operation but before long your crew warns you of an approaching ship. You hasten to leave before they get within firing range.

event.name: ROCK_MANTIS_HUNTER_MV
event.text: A Mantis ship here is adorned with Rock body parts! It would be a gorier display if they had internal organs, but the message is clear enough: this is a hunter of a very specialized kind.
No species deserves a Mantis hunter on their back - time to make the galaxy a little safer. Engage!
The Mantis take no interest in your ship - they're lying in wait for the next Rock ship to venture through. You're able to spin up the engines and jump at your leisure.

Before they have a chance, you ram your ship into theirs, causing irreparable damage to their engines. Luckily, your ship's armored hull is hardly dented from the impact. The Mantis ship careens away and you move in to attack.

choice.text: (Rock Crew) Put your Rock crewmember on the comm.

event.text: The two aliens face one another over the vidscreen. "Cave-dwelling pebble-man!" yells the furious Mantis captain. "See, I paint ship with your companions! I paint ship with you!"

event.name: ROCK_MANTIS_FREIGHTER_MV
event.text: A curious sight greets you at this beacon: a disabled Rock freighter drifts in space while two Mantis craft battle it out - presumably over who deserves the spoils.

choice.text: Wait, then attack the surviving Mantis.

event.text: There's quite enough action here already - prepare for light speed.

While the two Mantis fight you approach the Rock ship and send a repair drone through one of the many breaches. It fixes the ship up enough to make at least a single jump. You're surprised when, instead, they embark on a kamikaze run on the two Mantis, which results in the obliteration of all three!

While the two Mantis fight you approach the Rock ship and use a drone to fix up the ship. Once the breaches are fixed the life support flickers back on. In a matter of moments they are already in pursuit of one of the Mantis ships. Meanwhile the second Mantis turns toward you.

The Mantis craft are both too busy slaughtering one another to notice you. Eventually the smaller ship gets the upper hand, but they must have blown a fuse in the assault and their weapons system is inoperable. Now is the time to attack!

The Mantis craft may have their differences, but when it comes to you they are of one mind. The smaller ship suffers a power failure as it moves to engage, but the larger one lets off a volley of fire and moves in to attack!

event.name: ROCK_ZOLTAN_HELP_MV
event.text: It seems a Zoltan ship came here to liberate a Rock settlement from their 'oppressive belief system', and that the settlement did not appreciate it - long-range scanners suggest the Zoltans and their pursuers will be here at any moment!

The... extreme nature of Rock faith is well-known; the Zoltans can hardly be blamed for trying to broaden their horizons. The pursuing Rock ship quickly assesses the situation and decides two captured alien ships are better than one.
This is Rock territory, and therefore Rock law - the Zoltans should have known better than to interfere. You'll have to neutralize the crew to ensure their safe capture.
This is none of your concern - power up the jump drive!

event.name: ROCK_ATHEIST
event.text: You encounter a small craft with minimal propulsion; its Rock crew-member explains that the Rock home-world is run on lies and propaganda that keep the populace in check, and that they want no part of it.

choice.text: Tell them their god sent them here to join your crew.
Promise to share with them the truths they've been denied.
(Upg. Sensors) Show them to your data suite.

event.text: The Rock captain is impressed by the data you've collected and agrees to stay with you until they find their footing in the galaxy.

choice.text: (Lost Sun Crew) Teach them the ways of the Lost Suns.

event.text: The Rock captain is surprised, as he had previously thought the Lost Suns were a band of radical terrorists. Assured your ship will keep no secrets from them, he joins your crew.

choice.text: (Floral Crew) Have your Orchid talk them into joining you.

event.text: The Orchids are not only a race trusted by the Rockmen, but their government is incredibly well known for its transparency. Soothed by your crew, the Orchid talks them into coming with you, promising it'll be a better life than that among the Elders' lies.

textList.name: ROCK_ATHEIST_BAD
textList.text: They barely hear out your appeals before yelling, "These are the lies I sought to escape!" Looks like they're charging weapons!
They listen to your appeals and whisper, "Traitors to truth. You're no better than them!" Chaos ensues.

event.text: Your promises gain their attention and they agree to serve with you, for a while.
They seem tempted by your offer, but decide they can't risk being lied to again. They close frequencies and jump away.
They seem tempted by your offer, but decide they can't risk being lied to again. They close frequencies and jump away.

event.name: ROCK_LIVE_MINE
event.text: The burnt out hull of a Rock Trapper drifts by. Behind the wreck drifts a live mine; an automated drone that drills into ships' hulls before exploding. However, it can't detect you from this range, and you wonder if it's even active. Still, it's risky...
You pick apart the hull of the ship, and find some scrap, ammunition, and a Mine Launcher! However, before you can leave the mine activates, and begins to seek out your ship!
The ship's turning circle proves too wide and the mine bites down onto the hull. You can hear it now, chewing through the armor.

choice.text: Send someone out there to defuse it.
With no one around, your only option is to patiently wait for your demise.

event.text: The weapon detonates. Everything goes dark, the bridge illuminated by flames pouring from the hull. You put out the fires and prepare to move on.

choice.text: (Missile Weapon) Attempt a controlled detonation using a missile.

event.text: After drawing straws, a crewmember goes out to fix a modified warhead to the mine. You detonate the missile in a way that dislodges the mine. It blows up shortly after. The ship takes some damage in the blasts, but you're still sailing.

choice.text: (Beam Drone) Use a drone to cut away the mine with a precision beam. [-1|]

event.text: Carefully guided from the bridge, your Beam Drone removes the mine's grappling arms and sends it drifting off into space, where you shoot at it until it detonates at a safe distance.
It stresses the inertial dampeners, but you reverse course and outrun the mine. You prepare to jump off.

choice.text: (Hull Armor) Your armor will protect you.

event.text: The mine struggles to even burrow into your ship. Its drill eventually runs out of power and drifts away, now rendered harmless.

choice.text: (Energy Shield) Your shield will protect you.

event.text: The mine is incapable of getting past your Energy Shield. It explodes without even touching your ship's hull.
Fortunately, your Defense Drone quickly locks onto the mine and shoots it down before it can connect to the ship.
It's not worth it to investigate. The beacon is likely littered with scattered mines in other places too, so you decide to not remain here for long.
Your crewmember dons a space suit and exits the airlock. They make quick work of the basic device and return inside to relief all round. The mine makes good scrap pickings too.
Your crewmember dons a space suit and exits the airlock. When they open up the mine housing, though, they panic. The red wire or the blue?! 3... 2... 1...

choice.text: (Elite Crew) Send your elite to defuse the bomb.

event.text: Your Elite doesn't hesitate. They pull off a second panel in the back, and cut the newly revealed green wire. Miraculously, the bomb deactivates!
You open your eyes and everything is still where it was a moment ago. You did it!

The weapon detonates. Everything goes dark, the bridge illuminated by flames pouring from the hull, your bomb disposal volunteer spinning off toward a nearby sun. You put out the fires and prepare to move on.

removeCrew.text: Fortunately, your crewmember was close enough to the ship for the Clone Bay to revive them. Sheepish and apologetic, they rejoin the crew.

event.name: ROCK_SLUG_ARGUMENT_MV
event.text: You find a Slug Cruiser and Rock ship at a standoff, both with weapons armed and ready to fight. You could intervene before this gets out of hand.

choice.text: Hail them to see what's wrong.

event.text: The Slug captain explains that they upgraded the Rock ship's reactor and now the 'thick boulder heads' are refusing to pay for the work done. The Rock Captain says the 'gelatinous ooze rats' did a poor job that is not worth their agreed upon price.

choice.text: Offer to pay off the Rock debt.

event.text: You pay off the debt. The Rock Captain still seems annoyed at the Slug's getting their 'undeserved' scrap, but at least the situation will remain peaceful.

choice.text: Demand the Rock ship pay the agreed upon price.
(Rock Crew) Talk the Rock into peacefully paying the full price.

event.text: With much grumbling, the Rock Captain agrees to pay the price.

choice.text: Demand the Slug ship give a full refund.
(Slug Crew) Talk the Slugs into peacefully accepting the new price.

event.text: With much grumbling, the Slug Captain agrees to give a full refund.

choice.text: (Mind Control) Mind Control the Slugs into giving a full refund.

event.text: You calibrate the Mind Control to lock onto the Slug ship... but nothing happens. It's at this moment you remember Slugs can't be mind controlled at all. The Slug captain laughs at your pitiful attempt and you leave in shame.

choice.text: You have better things to attend to, leave them.

event.text: You leave the two ships to their bickering.
Apparently the Rock Captain was more annoyed than you thought, they shut off all communication and turn on you, the 'slime balls' defender.
With much grumbling, the Rock Captain agrees to pay the price.

A massive explosion emanates from the Rock Ship, shattering its hull and sending debris on an unavoidable collision course to your ship. Seems like that reactor upgrade was poorly done after all, and the Slugs took the opportunity to jump away.
The Slugs offer their thanks for your help, and jump away. Their true appreciation is questionable, but at least you can get back to your mission.
The Slug Captain offers a free reactor upgrade for your help. It never hurts to get a little power boost!
The Slug Captain, thankful for your help, offers a reactor upgrade for your ship... for a 'fair' price.
You let their team on board and after a short time they finish their work.
You break communications and prepare to move on.
"Hahahah! Like hell I'd take the adviccce of a Federation captain, essspecccially when he tellss me I should just let myssself get ssscammed out of my money!" The Slug ship immediately turns hostile!
You're pretty certain you hear the Slugs say some nasty things about your mother under their breath, but they do reluctantly accept the Rockman's new price.

A massive explosion emanates from the Rock Ship, shattering its hull and sending debris on an unavoidable collision course to your ship. Seems like that reactor upgrade was poorly done after all, and the Slugs took the opportunity to jump away.
The Rock captain grumbles then jumps away without another word. You know Rockmen tend to be ungrateful as a culture, but this is just plain rude.
The Rock captain seems rather ungrateful for your assistance, and still bent out of shape by his unsatisfactory reactor upgrades. "And what am I supposed to do about this crapjob upgrade?"

With some scrap of your own, you work on the Rockman's reactor to spruce it up. "Still a cruddy job, but at least you aren't as bad as those sludge gushers." It's a very reluctant compliment, but you can tell the Rockman appreciates it because he returns carrying a gift!

You aren't sure what reaction you expected from this response, but the abrupt laughter from the Rock captain surprises you. "I like your style." Brief, but a compliment from a Rockman is nothing to scoff at. Especially since it's followed by a small gift as a "thank you" for helping them.

event.name: ROCK_RAVINE
event.text: On the surface of a nearby planet is a massive ravine. It all looks normal until you spot two Rock scouts flying past, deeper into the ravine.

You trail the ships from far behind, making sure they can't see you but never losing them. Not too long after you reach a fork in the ravine, and the ships split up. If you don't want the Rebel fleet catching up, you'll only have time to explore one of the paths.

choice.text: Follow the ship to the left.

event.text: The ship stops at what looks like a giant facility built into the face of the ravine's sheer drop. With nowhere to hide, the Rockmen inevitably spot you and prepare to defend whatever the facility may be.

choice.text: Follow the ship to the right.

event.text: The ship lands near a giant prison camp built on the floor of the ravine. It looks abandoned, but you don't have much time to investigate before the Rockmen spot your ship and attacks.

choice.text: Nevermind, this is a bad idea.

event.text: Those Rockmen could be doing anything down there, and it's none of your business.

event.name: ROCK_RAVINE_LEFT
event.text: You've defeated the Rock vessel. You have some time to scrap the ship before investigating the facility.

The entrance to the structure leads you to a deprecated lobby. A barely functional elevator suggests there must be a back-up generator running, because this facility has long since been abandoned. There's several different options for floors to explore, but you'll only have time for one.

A floor marked control in a Rock facility is sure to be an interesting experience. You head there, wary of the elevator. Inside is a no-longer functional Mind Control system and a giant screen overlooking what looks to be a giant prison camp on the other side of the ravine. You begin to think there's nothing of actual use in this room until you notice a combat augment in the corner, as well as some discarded fuel cells.

The security floor has piqued your interest. You head there, wary of the elevator. Heavy blast doors protect the way in, but something has managed to bend them back far enough for you to squeeze by. Several monitors overlooks the other rooms of the facility, proving it to be completely empty of staff. Not much here is of value to a military ship, other than a Long-Ranged Scanners augmentation and some droneparts.

The armory seems like the obvious choice. You head there, wary of the elevator. Inside you find several racks of supplies and various weapons. With limited manpower, you take one of the weapons at random as well as a few missiles.

event.name: ROCK_RAVINE_RIGHT
event.text: You've defeated the Rock vessel. You have some time to scrap the ship before investigating the camp.

The Rock prison camp appears to be primarily abandoned, but a lone camp fire that's still burning suggests there may still be some life left behind. You're proven correct when further exploration reveals a small band of prisoners of various races. They explain that the prisoners revolted and managed to kill off most of the Rock guards. The Rockmen retreated and the surviving prisoners starved to death. This small group are the only ones who remain. You don't have enough space on the ship to take them all with you, but you can probably bring one of them.

choice.text: Bring one of the Rock prisoners.

event.text: The Rock bears the markings of an outcast, likely a fugitive from the Rock government who was recently captured. They don't speak much, but you can tell they're glad you've chosen to rescue them.

choice.text: Bring one of the Human prisoners.

event.text: The human turns out to be a Rebel Engineer, captured by the Rockmen with the intent to be used as a hostage to bargain with the Rebels. Unfortunately for them, the Rebels had no interest in buying back the prisoner. They were locked into this camp. Despite being of Rebel origins, they are more than glad to come with you and leave behind this place.

choice.text: Bring one of the Slug prisoners.

event.text: The Slug was a tourist captured by the Rockmen based purely on suspicion. Not wanting to admit to their mistake, they simply chose to lock the Slug away in this prison for the rest of eternity. They're vibrant with energy at the prospect of finally being free.

event.name: ROCK_ASTEROID_COLONY
event.text: It appears complete chaos has broken out on the nearby Rock colony. It seems a large asteroid collided with the planet and caused extreme damage, and now hundreds of ships are swarming back and forth from the planet's surface.
You fly towards the planet's surface and engage a pirate ship currently firing on unarmed Rock civilians.

choice.text: This is chaos. We should leave.

event.text: You avoid the colony and the ships around it.

event.name: ROCK_ASTEROID_COLONY_PIRATE
event.text: The pirate vessel crashes down into the ground, but luckily the civilians are unharmed. No one protests as you salvage the wreckage of the pirate ship.

Most of the Rockmen are too panicked and flee as you approach. A few of the more sensible individuals stop to hear you out. You offer to transport as many of them as you can carry, an offer which most of them refuse. One young Rockman however accepts, even going so far as to join your crew.

Most of the Rockmen are too panicked and flee as you approach. A few of the more sensible individuals stop to hear you out. You offer to transport as many of them as you can carry, an offer which most of them refuse. One young Rockman however accepts, even going so far as to join your crew.
As you approach, a pirate ship locks onto you and fires a few shots across your hull. You're forced to pull away, but the pirates follow in pursuit!
The only place safe for you to land is near empty patch of land that was once a residential complex. Now reduced to rubble, you salvage what little hasn't already been taken.
The Rock Enforcers are too busy dealing with the pirates to notice you. You swoop in and collect as much as you can.
It seems one of the Elite rock vessels trying to fend off the pirates has noticed you. You're chased by the ship, and it seems a fight is unavoidable.

event.name: ROCK_CRUSADE
event.text: A cluster of Inquisition ships are resting nearby, making minor repairs. They haven't noticed you.
"Federation ship, you are not welcome here! Do not contact us again, unless you have a death wish."
"Gah! Now you've asked for it."

choice.text: (Theocracy Crew) Have your Rockman contact them.

event.text: "One of us? Perhaps I was mistaken of your origins. We have encountered an unpredicted obstacle in our usual duties. A Mantis vessel, full of heretics and scum, has made the fatal mistake of entering our sector! Unfortunately, it seems we're not fully prepared for their boarding tactics. Are you able to fulfill our mission and destroy the Mantis?"

The Inquisition ships give you the co-ordinates of the Mantis. To your surprise, they aren't far away, so close in fact that they inhabit the same beacon. Another unexpected turn is that they are no Hive Mantis ship, but rather Free Mantis! "Oh, Federation! Hello! We glad to see you. This sector weird, yes? Not long ago, we chased by big blue ship with angry stone man. Very scary."

choice.text: Follow through with your promise and kill the Free Mantis.

event.text: You have a mission to follow through with. You arm your weapons and engage the Free Mantis.
The Rockmen are enraged at your betrayal. "This is an insult beyond anything I have ever experienced! You are weak, and must be punished."
"Then you are of no use to us. Leave at once."
You put some distance between you and the Rockmen, just to be safe.

event.name: ROCK_CRUSADE_FREEMANTIS
event.text: You've defeated the Free Mantis ship. You salvage the remains.

choice.text: Confirm your success with the Inquisition.

event.text: "A worthy display of your honor and prowess. I applaud you. Accept this as a token of gratitude."

event.name: ROCK_CRUSADE_ROCK
event.text: You've defeated the Rockmen. You salvage the remains.
"Scary stone man dead now? Wow... this sector very not friendly. I come with you now, and bring twin brother."

event.name: ROCK_NURSERY_MV
event.text: Fluctuating life-signs are reported near the surface of a hazy, pock-marked moon in the vicinity. It seems this is a Rock nursery where the young are 'acclimatized' to their religion - only there's been some kind of coup and the students are running amok!

choice.text: Transfer an away team to investigate.

event.text: Your away team reports combat between students and authorities - it seems some of the students were considered to have dissident personalities and were to be imprisoned pro-actively.

choice.text: Order the away team to side with the students.

event.text: It's not long before the violence on the planet becomes a full-scale battle, your away team and their military-grade weaponry in the very center of it.

choice.text: Order the away team to side with the authorities.

event.text: It's not long before the violence on the planet becomes a full-scale battle, your away team and their military-grade weaponry in the very center of it.

choice.text: You lack the team required to oppose fanatical zealots... or opressed students.

event.text: As long as they're not shooting at the ship it's best to leave them be.

choice.text: (Adv. Weapons) Fire a warning shot near to the commotion to announce your arrival.

event.text: You dispatch a barrage of weapons fire that crashes home into an unused quarry near to the installation. Weapons fire on the surface ceases for as long as it takes for the moon's defense force to be dispatched to your location!
Things, in the end, do not go well. The enemy succeeds in flanking your team and they're forced to retreat to the ship.
The staff and authorities subdue the last of the renegade students; prison transport ships are already in orbit.

The fight goes poorly, and your team eventually finds itself out on the flank with a wounded Rock combatant in tow. They make a desperate push for the shuttle co-ordinates, but one falls. The survivor helps the injured Rock aboard.

removeCrew.text: Fortunately, your crewmember was close enough to the ship for the Clone Bay to revive them.

event.text: The staff and authorities subdue the last of the renegade students; prison transport ships are already in orbit.
Your team hunkers down in the main quad and succeeds in holding off the enemy combatants and claiming control of the institution!
The students secure the remaining staff and prepare to leave the solar system - there is only one path open to them now, that of the outlaw.

Your team comes under heavy fire. One is blinded by a flash bomb and staggers past the lip of a quarry and to their death far below; the other succeeds in joining with friendly forces and ultimately claims control of the institution!

removeCrew.text: Fortunately, your crewmember was close enough to the ship for the Clone Bay to revive them.

event.text: The students secure the remaining staff and prepare to leave the solar system - there is only one path open to them now, that of the outlaw.

As the battle proceeds the action moves away from your team's location. During the lull they're able to secure some abandoned weapons; by the time they're done the battle is largely over and they return to ship.

event.text: The staff and authorities subdue the last of the renegade students; prison transport ships are already in orbit.

As the battle proceeds the action moves away from your team's location. During the lull they're able to secure some abandoned weapons; by the time they're done the battle is largely over and they return to ship.

event.name: ROCK_NURSERY_MV_WIN
event.text: In return for your support during the fight the survivors reward you with the funds set aside for prison transport. You leave before anyone changes their mind!

event.name: ROCK_NURSERY_MV_LOSE
event.text: Fully aware that their victory was threatened by your arrival, the survivors immediately dispatch a ship to eliminate you!

event.name: DISTRESS_REFUGEE_ROCK
event.text: You have encountered a refugee ship drifting in space. It looks as if it was fleeing the Rebel advance and ran out of fuel. Its distress beacon is active, but you're not sure anyone is on board.
You're wary of the refugees but figure it's safe to do something on the ship.
As you hail the refugee ship, a Rock ship suddenly jumps into the system... The Rockmen accuse you of protecting heretics and gives you no time to argue before it raises its weapons.

event.name: DISTRESS_ROCK_DETAINING_ZOLTAN
event.text: You find a Zoltan merchant ship that is sending out a distress call. Its escape is being blocked by a Theocracy patrol. There are no signs of a struggle.

choice.text: Hail the Zoltans to see what's wrong.

event.text: "You're with the Federation, are you not? We are being ex-" They are abruptly cut off from transmitting. The Rock ship hails you.
"Leave now, Renegade. We are within our right to detain merchants, even if they are from the Ministry."

choice.text: (Theocracy Elite) "The Ministry is our ally. Release them at once."

event.text: "Er..." The Theocracy captain stumbles over his word. "That is to say... we were just... We needed to ask them some questions..." The Rockman clears his throat. "...They're free to go, then. We hope you'll overlook our... enthusiasm for our duties." To punctuate this, the Rockmen give you a tribute.

choice.text: (Theocracy-Aligned Rockman) Ask what charge the merchants are being held on.

event.text: "They are under suspicion of spreading Federation lies! If they want to prove their respect for our customs, they will have to provide monetary compensation for the damage they have done to our culture!"

choice.text: Sounds like you're just extorting them.
Demand the release of the Zoltans.

event.text: The Rockmen save you the trouble of engaging and attack you first!
The Theocracy and the Ministry are allies - whatever is happening is between them.

Your Rock crewmember admonishes the patrol for their greed. Their words get through to the opposing Rock, and his tone softens. "Ah... well..." The Rock patrolman clears his throat. "...That's not who I am. I would... I would never. Let me prove to you I am a generous man." The Rockman releases the Zoltans and gives you a small tribute.
Your Rock crewmember admonishes the patrol for their greed, but this only angers the Rockmen on the other ship. "Insolent whelp! I will not be insulted by a Rock who serves aboard an enemy ship!"

event.name: ROCK_DETAINING_ZOLTAN_CONVINCE
event.text: "Thank you for convincing them to step away. Why would the Theocracy abuse its power like that?" The merchant sighs. "Would you like to purchase anything from our store?"

event.name: ROCK_DETAINING_ZOLTAN_DEFEAT
event.text: "Thank you for intervening on our behalf, Renegade. We never suspected the patrol would abuse its power like that... Would you like to purchase anything from our store?"

event.name: DISTRESS_ROCK_OUTCAST_PREY
event.text: The distress beacon leads you to a half-destroyed Outcast ship, ravaged by what seems to be the nearby pirate ship. Their previous target disposed of, they now turn to you!

event.name: ROCK_OUTCAST_SAVE
event.text: You check on the victim, and to your surprise find a survivor! You help them on your ship.

"So much for freedom... as soon as we saw a way out of this hellhole that the Elders imposed on us, pirates picked us apart. Is the harsh grip of our presumed leaders a necessary evil to protect us? Either way, what me and my brothers had in mind absolutely went off the wrong foot. Where am I even supposed to seek shelter?"

choice.text: Encourage them to join the Lost Suns.

event.text: "You have a point. This was the original plan, but unfortunately we never managed to contact them in our makeshift escape. The teachings and expertise they can offer will reinforce me, despite the misadventures encountered on the way." With your ties to the Federation, it doesn't take too much time to pinpoint the location of a nearby Lost Sun ship that can arrange the transfer.

choice.text: Encourage them to rejoin the Theocracy.

event.text: "It remains to be seen if I can just backtrack and be accepted again... but it's for the best." Your new passenger informs you of the location of a station in their native system, and you plan a course there.

choice.text: Encourage them to seek shelter at the Sister-Species Liberation Group.

event.text: "I have heard a little about this cause. I don't know if I can find peace among the Crystals, but their intentions seems genuine." Your new passenger informs you of the location of a station in the neighbouring systems they managed to hear about when they weren't drowned by the propaganda of the Theocracy.

choice.text: Encourage them to remain an Outcast.

event.text: It's harsh, but you reveal to them that anybody making a run from the Theocracy should endure what is roughly survival of the fittest, that many of their peers don't always make it. "Yes, I suppose you have a point... You've convinced me, Renegade. Without a vessel or crew to roll with now though... I shall stay with you then. My chances will significantly improve under your care." Seeing as their former vessel is in no state to fly, you gather what can still be of use from it.

event.name: ROCK_OUTCAST_LOSTSUN

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: You agreed to escort an Outcast survivor to the Lost Suns.

event.text: You've arrived at the system, and you've spotted the expected Lost Sun ship. They are wary, but you patch the Outcast through.

After explaining their journey, the Outcast expresses their desire to join the Lost Suns and vouches for you in return for the help you provided. They accept their new recruit, and offer you military supplies for your deeds.

event.name: ROCK_OUTCAST_ROCK

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: You agreed to escort an Outcast survivor to a Rock station.

event.text: You've arrived at the system, and you've spotted the Rock station. You feel at unease sticking around, and you start to regret your decision, but the Outcast opens comms.

After explaining their journey, the Outcast expresses their desire to reintegrate the Theocracy and vouches for you in return for the help you provided. The Rockman at the other end though doesn't seems so eager to accept them back. "Foolish, foolish... why should we offer refuge to filth, who decided to splinter from the grace of those who paved the way for our-"

A second figure comes and interrupts their peer. "Silence, brother. Yes, this one... he has strayed, but few are those who recognize their mistakes, and even fewer are those who seek to repent toward our ways. Let him in, at once. As for you, foreigner... your compassion will be rewarded. We will permit you to dock and access our services, once the refugee will be under our responsibility."

event.name: ROCK_OUTCAST_SSLG

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: You agreed to escort an Outcast survivor to a SSLG station.

event.text: You've arrived at the system, and you catch sight of what seems to be SSLG infrastructure in the horizon. You approach cautiously and are hailed by a Crystal demanding your reasons to be here, and you let the Outcast speak through.

After explaining their journey, the Outcast expresses their desire to seek shelter among the Crystals and vouches for you in return for the help you provided. They eagerly accept, and not only do they award you a spare weapon, one of the liberators wishes to join your cause in belief that more Rockmen can be helped on the way.

event.name: ROCK_ASTROLOGER
event.text: There's a small Rock colony at this beacon: most notably, there is also a massive telescope in orbit. It seems there's an astronomical laboratory here.

"A ship! It's been too long. Oh, an outsider? Well, that will have to do. The Theocracy hasn't been listening to us recently. On behalf of the Rock Astrologer Association, I implore you to listen and give me some assistance."

"There is a crystalline comet making its way through this sector. Comets are common in Theocracy space, but there are some that have some fascinating properties. I believe this comet could contain many secrets about the past of the Crystals."

choice.text: Why wouldn't the Theocracy be interested in investigating?

event.text: The 'astrologer' gives a hefty sigh. "They used to. Back before the Crystals rejoined the galactic scene, these comets were the only trace of their existence we had. We would chase comet after comet, and no matter how little they turned up, we would still have the funding to chase them down. But now that we can physically talk to the Crystals, the Theocracy no longer sees the value in it. They see chasing comets as menial busywork, and refuse to give us any funding... But that doesn't mean it isn't worth it!"
"Fantastic. You may keep what you find, but please send me the data when you get it!"
"Hpmh. Astrologers get no respect these days."
"Fantastic. You may keep what you find, but please send me the data when you get it!"
"Hpmh. Astrologers get no respect these days."
This area seems to be of low priority to the Theocracy, so you have ample time to spend.

event.name: QUEST_ASTROLOGER_COMET

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: A Rock astrologer asked you to seek out a comet passing through this beacon.

event.text: You arrive at the site of the comet that the Astrologer tasked you to find.
As you investigate the comet, to your surprise, a chunk of it detaches... it's a Crystal ship! "You have no right to interfere with our mission!"

Ruwen holds his hands up. "I am sorry to disturb you from stasis. The Empire has changed its foreign policy since then. In fact, this whole thing started with me, many years ago. I advise you to return to the Empire to receive new orders."
"Ruwen? It must have been many years. It looks like you changed."
"Yes, I am the ambassador to the outside world. The galaxy requires our presence once more."
The other Crystals seem mystified, but they offer you a tribute as an apology for their aggression.

choice.text: Accept the offering and report to the Astrologer.

event.text: "Incredible... we've searched so many of them back in the day and never heard of Crystals dwelling within them... and this isn't even a recent development?"

choice.text: (Dianesh) "Your empress commands you to stand down."

event.text:
"Empress Dianesh? What are you doing aboard an outsider's ship?"
"The Empire is taking an active role in galactic civilization once more. Your reconnaissance is no longer required."
"...of course, my liege. Please accept this offering as an apology."

choice.text: Accept the offering and report to the Astrologer.

event.text: "Incredible... we've searched so many of them back in the day and never heard of Crystals dwelling within them... and this isn't even a recent development?"

choice.text: (Crystal Crew) Try to reason with them.

event.text: "What are you doing consorting with outsiders? You are a disgrace to the Crystal Empire!" It looks like you couldn't de-escalate the situation!
The comet seems fairly unremarkable at first glance, but once you examine beneath the surface, you find crystalline technology hidden within.
"Aha! At last, I have found what I was looking for! Oh, I suppose you can keep the actual artifacts, but the data you have acquired is very useful."
The comet is, sadly, completely unremarkable, at least as far as you are concerned. You find some trace amounts of metals to harvest, but it ultimately feels like a waste of time.
"How fascinating! You see, the composition of the Crystal suggests that the age of this was from several millennia ago! What a find! ...what, you expected more?"

At first, the crystal seems basically unremarkable. However, after scraping away some of the surface, you find a strange signal within. However, the crystal is tough. It will take very deliberate strikes to shatter the weak-points of the shell.

choice.text: (Ruwen) "This is ancient! Let me try something."

event.text: Ruwen heads down to the crystal. He presses against the surface, and completely phases into it. Moments later the crystal opens up, and Ruwen returns to your ship, allowing you to examine the cargo.

choice.text: (Dianesh) "These were all thought to be lost... Let me look at it."

event.text: Dianesh flies to the comet in a shuttle. She taps the crystal in very specific places with the side of the shuttle: it hums and echoes until the crystal opens up.

choice.text: (Heavy Weapon) Shatter the crystal with an onslaught of attacks.

event.text: You target the weakest areas with your heaviest weapons, pummeling it. The crystal is tough, but eventually it shatters open, allowing you access inside.

choice.text: Just send the Astrologer your findings.

event.text: "Oh, how interesting! ...it's a shame you could not crack the crystal open, I am sure that whatever was inside would have been of great value. Still, your contribution is appreciated."

event.name: COMET_DWELLERS_ASTROLOGER
event.text: "Incredible... we've searched so many of them back in the day and never heard of Crystals dwelling within them... could this be a recent development?"

choice.text: Scuttle whatever else you can find on the comet.

event.name: COMET_ASTROLOGER_ANCIENT
event.text: Inside of the comet is, surprisingly, some strange green, cubical technology. It all looks very old and not exactly in the best shape, but the quality of the craftsmanship is apparent even having been so ancient.

"Incredible! Never in my wildest dreams did I ever expect anything on this level... Ah, what a shame that this technology did not end up in our hands, but it is their fault for never listening to us!"

event.name: ROCK_SUN_CHALLENGE
event.text: You are immediately messaged by an imposing looking Rock war vessel, "You're the ship off to 'save the Federation', aren't you? And you expect to survive with that hunk of junk?"

choice.text: "We're going to save them or die trying."

event.text: "The latter being more likely. Still... we can potentially help you and your precious fleet, but you'll need to prove yourself first. Meet us at these coordinates." They jump away.
"One ship is not the same as a fleet, but at least you've got some fire. Meet us at these coordinates if you want to prove to us that the Federation is worth saving." They jump away.
"Heh. Like I expected. If the Federation is as weak as you it deserves to fall." They jump away without another word.

event.name: ROCK_SUN_CHALLENGE2

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: An Inquisition vessel has requested that you meet them here so they can judge your prowess.

event.text: You arrive at the coordinates given and find yourself dangerously close to an M-class star! The other ship messages you, "Let's see how long your puny ship can handle this heat! Prepare for a challenge!"

event.name: ROCK_SUN_CHALLENGE3

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: The Inquisition vessel you held out against transmitted these coordinates.

event.text: You arrive at a massive Rockman shipyard and notice the ship that had just tried to kill you is docked and already being repaired. "Well fought! I must say I did not expect you to survive."
"I am convinced of your strength and pledge to assist your cause. Let us patch up your hull, and provide you with some supplies."

event.name: QUEST_ROCK_MARRIAGE_START
event.text: A Rock captain hails you: "It is improper of me to contact off-worlders, but this is an emergency. We were on our way to deliver our passenger to her new husband - the Grand Basilisk of Numa V - when our engines broke down. Will you take possession of her and make haste to Numa V?"
"You surprise me, off-worlder. Thank you. The passenger will be with you momentarily." She refuses to enter the main hold and prefers to wait in the cargo bay.
Arranged marriages aren't on your list of worthy causes. You leave the Rock to their business.

event.name: ROCK_QUEST_MARRIAGE
event.text: A vast tunnel network near the surface of Numa V indicates an advanced Rock civilization. This must be where you were asked to deliver the passenger.

Realizing arrival is imminent, the passenger - silent so far - pleads with you not to hand her over. She's interrupted by the Grand Basilisk's Chief Aid: "To the alien vessel holding the Basilisk's wife. Deliver her to us. You will be rewarded... well."
"May your children erode into dust!" she screams as she's bundled into the waiting shuttle. The Rock guards on board hurriedly drop off an exotic piece of technology and return to the Grand Basilisk.
"I was led to believe your kind did not know mercy. I will join you. But quickly, we must jump away - they will not tolerate..." She's interrupted by weapons fire from the Basilisk's escort!

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_ROCK
textList.text: You encounter a Rock vessel and attempt to open trading frequencies, but they take it as an act of cultural transgression and open fire.
You jump into the middle of a Rock excavation project on a nearby moon. Unimpressed with your intrusion they move to defend themselves!
You intercept chatter from an approaching Rock ship: "Weapons, moving in to engage, arm the tubes." There is no talking to these guys.
As you jump in, a vast figure appears on the view-screen. The Rock captain rubs the green, moss-like appendage on his chin and then orders his crew to open fire.

It looks quiet, but you realize your computer is being scanned. A hidden Rock vessel hails you: "Why do you fill your computer with lies?! These are not the holy words!" Before you can interject they open fire.
You notice a Rock ship performing combat exercises. However, they quickly change their course to engage your ship. They apparently treat unregistered alien ships as handy target practice.
A loud 'thud' resounds through the ship after jump completion - you've just shunted a Rock fighter and he's already preparing to fire!
You're intercepted by a Rock salvage operation. They don't seem to mind that you're still on board while they junk your ship.

textList.name: ROCK_FIGHT_ASTEROID
textList.text: A Rock mining vessel is harvesting the mineral-rich asteroids in this locality, and their scouts take your presence to be a transgression. Battle stations!
A rookie Rock cargo ship has taken its orders too literally and took the most direct route to their destination... right through an asteroid field. They're confused and fire wildly as you jump in.

The captain of a Rock freighter lost in the asteroid field hails you: "Our co-ordinates led us here, but only death greets us. What must be must be. Death to all." You power up the battle systems and wonder how long they've been stuck here.

textList.name: BOARDERS_ROCK_ASTEROID
textList.text: You arrive in an asteroid field and immediately begin evasive maneuvers when a loud clunk reverberates through the ship. At first you think the hull has been hit, but the noise came from some Rock intruders teleporting aboard the ship!

Your shields are being taxed as they deflect the debris from an asteroid field. As you weave your way between the rocks, you happen upon a Rock pirate stronghold. You register teleport signatures and hear shouts aboard the ship.

textList.name: BOARDERS_ROCK_SUN
textList.text: As soon as you arrive you hear the telltale sounds of a teleporter and shouts reverberating through the ship, "Prepare to burn, fleshy meat-sack aliens!"
With their high resistance to heat, outlaw Rocks often settle very close to stars. That is why it is hardly surprising when your ship gets boarded as you stumble past a hidden settlement.

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_ROCKHOME
textList.text: You catch chatter on the nearby Rock ship. In a hush tone, they speak of your ship and what vile sins must be committed aboard it. Eager to enact out the Elders' law, they power up weapons and attack!
The Rock citizens are perhaps some of the best armed civilians of any race. Unfortunately, that means just about every ship you encounter here is more than willing to engage you in a brawl.
You've stepped foot in the Rock Homeworlds, the highly valued sanctuary for the Rock people. It is no wonder that the irate citizens of this sector seek your destruction so eagerly.
"This one, he is not covered in stone! We shall cut off his head, and mount it to our wall as a trophy!" It doesn't seem the Rockmen here are willing to negotiate.
There is a very thin line between civilians and military in the Rock Homeworlds. It's hard to tell the origins of the ship here, but nevertheless they're hostile and looking for a fight.
Your very presence in this sector is a tremendous insult to Rock-kind. The Rockmen in the nearby system aren't pleased with your presence and decide to deal with you themselves.
Rockmen aren't particularly friendly, but you know you've made a real mistake coming here when the civilians near this beacon go out of their way to initiate combat with you.

event.name: ENCOUNTER_LOSTSUN_ROCKHOME
event.text: A Lost Sun ship, seeking out Rock citizens to capture and take back to the Stronghold as prisoners, identifies your ship. "Traitorous coward! A Federation vessel, out here, giving aid to the Rock Elders' followers? You are scum! I will roast all of you alive." They aren't exactly correct, but you doubt arguing will help.

event.name: ROCK_CRYSTAL_WAYSTONE
event.text: It seems you've discovered the Crystalline Waystone, the device used to enter the Crystal Homeworlds. The beacon is shockingly empty, despite the boom in tourism that eventually lead to the exodus of the Crystal race back to the galactic scene.
Better not risk it. The Rock people are unlikely to respond well to vandalism.

choice.text: (Crystal Crew) Have your Crystal crew activate the device again.

event.text: Are you certain you want to do this? You will immediately be taken to the Crystal Homeworlds.
You break it apart and take it for scrap. No one will miss it.
As you start to break it apart a Rock military ship jumps nearby. "You think you can come into our sector and just steal whatever you please?! Prepare to die, vandals!"

event.name: ENCOUNTER_ROCK_ELITE
event.text: The Rockman Crusaders were once recruited to enact the Inquisition, a brutal invasion of other worlds deemed full of heretics to instate the 'wisdom' of the Elders. The Federation has officially put an end to the Inquisition long ago, but the Crusader rank has not yet been disbanded. They can still be seen on patrols to fulfill the schemes of the Elders and protect their claims from outsiders, such as yourself.

event.name: ROCK_ZOLTAN_PARASITE
event.text: A Rock station nearby is mass-broadcasting a request for medical aid. "Medical assistance required at Station R-0735Q. Need help extracting parasite. Will pay."

The Rockmen are mildly confused that a Federation ship is offering to help, but don't complain. "We are representatives for Zulfiqar Industries. Yesterday, CMO Rig Bramston arranged a meeting on these premises with a Zoltan envoy named Tintan to discuss means of distribution and marketing within the Ministry. However, we did not anticipate a Slug vessel to arrive shortly after and deploy a 'prank' on the meeting, mind controlling Rig to consume Tintan whole. As you can understand, we are now in quite the dilemma and need to operate immediately."

"My god... Tony? Is that you? How are you here?" You have no idea what's going on, but Tony explains. "7 years ago, Tony's was nothing but a small chain local only to the Republic and quite small. I hoped to change that around by selling Zulfiqar goods. I met with Rig to discuss the terms, when out of nowhere a Slug ship arrived and mind controlled me into sticking myself up Rig's... uh... asshole. The surgeons had no idea how to handle the situation. For 3 years we lived like that, stuck together. I was forced to eat Rig's waste to survive. Eventually we found a professional capable of separating us, but it was too late to save either of us from the permanent trauma."

The Rock station owners are completely baffled as to what is happening, but together you, Tony, Rig, and Tintan discuss the situation. It becomes clear Rig and Tintan won't be free of each other any time soon, but with Tony's help you might just be able to track down the Slugs responsible and get revenge.

Anurak passes the afflicted Rockman a bowl of soup. "How is this supposed to help?"
"Eh? Isn't it obvious? It's good for you!"
Rig drinks down the soup and looks pensive. "How strange. The situation doesn't feel as unnerving as it used to."
Anurak smiles. "What did I say? A little soup will do you some good! And, of course, it's helping the little one that's resting in your stomach."
Rig looks hesitant. "How long will this last?"
Anurak shakes his head. "Don't be stupid! You can't just drink soup once and expect to be fine forever. It has to be a part of your diet."
Rig looks annoyed. "Well, what am I supposed to do? I don't know how to make that kind of soup."
Anurak makes a forceful beckon. "What's that? You want me to make you soup every day? Well, if you insist."
With a resigned sigh, Rig and Tintan decide to tag along. The other Rocks look somewhat displeased that the situation wasn't properly resolved.

choice.text: (Alkali) Invent a pretext to study this intriguing specimen.

event.text:
"Oh dear! Thhhhis won't do at all! I regret to inform you thhhhat thhhis patient cannot be operated on." The Rockmen look confused. "Yes, if we cut thhhhe patient open, thhhhe Zoltan might undergo a transphhhhasic rupture, destroying bothhhh patients. If you let me take a look at thhhhe specimen- er, patient, I will no doubt be able to come up withhh somethhhhing safer."
The Rockmen seem concerned. "Aren't you going to leave?"
Alkali nods. "We have very important business. But we will release thhhe patients upon curing thhhhem."
The Rockmen sigh. "Fine. Payment on cure only, though." For the forseeable future, it looks like Tintan and Rig will be joining your crew. They're not happy about having to stick together, but at least with Alkali, they might have a chance for some proper treatment.
Still, you could have sworn that Alkali muttered something under his breath that sounded like "Too easy".

choice.text: (Mind Control) Convince the two to live in symbiosis aboard your ship.

event.text: Even under the effects of the mind control, it takes a lot of convincing to get the two to agree with forever existing among one another. Their life forever changed, now remarkably for the better, they thank you, and even ask to join your crew. The Rock station is confused as to what has happened, but Rig seems certain this is the right option in his stupor and the Rockmen agree to let him go.

choice.text: (Surgeon Drone) Perform surgery on the Rockman.

event.text: Without hesitation, the surgeon drone bursts into the station and makes a beeline for the patient at top speed, knocking over any Rocks that stand in its way. It applies anaesthesia, and then precisely makes an incision in Rig's abdomen. It removes the shivering Tintan, sealing up the incision as soon as possible. As it finishes up its treatment on both patients, the Rockmen approach, impressed. "Considering the level of care administered, we are willing to give a healthy reward. Where did you find this technology?"

"Arr, me systems say it's not possible, but I'll give 'er a go anyway." A55 slashes open Rig with a swing of his hook. The Rock grunts in pain as A55 extracts the Zoltan, all the while administering aid with his limited Doctor Drone capabilities. It's a makeshift job, but he manages to close the wound and treat both patients. The Rockmen look at you with concern, but relent. "What you did seems risky. And is that a pirate drone...? No matter. You did what you said, so we'll give you a reward for it."

choice.text: Your Doctor drone isn't capable of performing surgery of this caliber.
Your Medic informs you that a field medic is not qualified for this job.
Your Shell Scientist doesn't have sufficient familiarity with Rock or Zoltan biology to keep both patients alive and healthy.

event.text: Your Mantis, ever assured of its abilities, pushes past the Rockmen and marches into the room where the "infected" Rockman is being held. In a single swipe, it cuts straight through the stomach. The convulsing Zoltan falls out, quivering on the ground. The makeshift Rock medical team rushes in to fix the injured Rockman and physiologically evaluate the Zoltan. They aren't pleased with your solution, but they pay you as promised anyways.

choice.text: Suggest they simply put them out of their collective misery.

event.text: "Your advice is worthless. We cannot simply assassinate both a high ranking Zoltan official and our own commander. We ask that you leave, and we will wait for a more helpful ship to arrive."

choice.text: Offer to try and perform surgery.

event.text: "Do you have any training in operating of either of the two species? Or any species at all?" You shake your head. "Then get lost. We will wait for someone who knows what they are doing to arrive."
You ignore the Rock station and carry on your way.

event.name: ROCK_HOMEWORLDS
event.text: This beacon has landed you concerningly close to a densely populated Rock planet. You double-take when the ship computer informs you that this is no ordinary Rock planet, but rather Vrachos IV, the home planet of the Rock race.

The ship computer informs you on a few other details. Vrachos IV was largely abandoned because the massive industrial mining on the planet's surface led to a disastrous lack of necessary natural resources. This city, the capital of the Rock civilization, is one of the only few that remains populated. It is under strict control by one of the five Rock Elders, Stonewall. His incredibly uncreative name goes well in line with his uncreative methods of punishing dissidents, which usually involve torture and public executions.
The city below is bustling with activity, and far in the distance lays Stonewall's palace, blocking out the sunrise. It's not the biggest building here, but it commands the most attention.
You came to this reality to make a change and the Rock government is no better than the Rebels. As you approach the palace however, a gigantic Rock cruiser exits, ready to combat you.
A giant Rock city is no place for a Federation ship. You power up the thrusters and back away from the planet's surface.

event.name: ROCK_HOMEWORLDS_VICTORY
event.text: No ship can outmatch you, not even a mighty Elite Rock Cruiser. Now defeated, the remains of the cruiser go down into flames, destroying the vast garden leading up to the Palace's entrance. It's plenty to scrap, but you don't have much time with the Rock soldiers running out to meet you.

Along with the Rockmen comes Stonewall himself, extremely irate at the damage you caused. "What have you done! You have proven your point, everywhere you go you only bring destruction and disrupt our ways of life! What is it that you want, why have you come here to ruin this day? Will simple money be enough to make you leave?"

Reluctantly, the Rock soldiers put down their guns and a hefty sum of scrap is brought out for you. This won't have much lasting effect on the Rock government other than an increase in security, but atleast this will help with your primary mission.

choice.text: Use Stonewall as a hostage and bargain for an even greater reward.
The ship AI suggests taking Stonewall as a hostage. Unfortunately, you lack a proper team for this option to be considered.
We came here to make a change. Assassinate Stonewall now.
You came here to make a change. Fire all weapons on Stonewall.

event.text: You're far quicker than any of the guards, and in only a couple of seconds your blaster is held directly against Stonewall's head. It's a dangerous and nerve-racking exchange, but everything goes as 'planned' and a Rock transport delivers a large supply of goods.

It was a risky move, and things don't go nearly as 'planned'. The Rock guards are quicker than anticipated and one of your crew is shot in the chest. You still manage to grab Stonewall around his massive neck and hold a blaster to his moss-covered face. As your crew lies dying on the floor, a Rock transport is called in to deliver the larger amount of supplies. Once you're satisfied, you hurry back to the ship, making sure to keep your gun pointed at Stonewall the entire way back.

choice.text: (Upg. Medbay) Provide medical assistance to your crew.

event.text: Luckily your crew is able to be treated in time. You pull away from the city, glad at the success of the mission.

choice.text: (Medical Crew) Provide medical assistance to your crew.

event.text: Luckily your crew is able to be treated in time. You pull away from the city, glad at the success of the mission.

choice.text: There's nothing we can do to save our crew.

event.text: Your crew perishes in front of you, a casualty that could have been prevented if you simply hadn't tried something so daring.

removeCrew.text: Luckily your crew is cloned, relieving you of some of your guilt.

event.name: ROCK_HOMEWORLDS_VICTORY_KILL
event.text: You swiftly draw your blaster and blast Stonewall straight in the chest. The mighty titan of a creature falls to the ground in a thud, and the Rock soldiers are sent into chaos. You rush back to the ship but are stopped by the surge of Rock citizens breaking down the palace gates. A large horde of onlookers, witnessing your brave execution of their long-time brutal dictator, have been pushed to revolt, and they are stampeding to take down the soldiers.

It's a violent fight, and there's heavy casualties on both sides, but with your trained military crew you help sway the tide in the civilians' favor. Once the battle is for certain over, the civilians thank you for your help. Most march on to take control of Stonewall's palace, but one Rock, a Crusader who turned on his masters, stays behind. "You have done us a considerable service, and I cannot let this go without thanks. Our kind may finally be free from this oppression, and this could very well be the start. I want to stay behind and keep fighting, but I also know a Federation ship passing through here with such a powerful loadout has a very important mission awaiting them, and they can use all of the manpower they can get."

Hopefully this newfound spark of hope you've started among the Rock people won't be smothered by the reinforcements the other Elders are bound to send. You can't risk your mission any further, so you power up the engines and fly away from the city.

event.name: ROCK_HOMEWORLDS_VICTORY_KILL_AUTO
event.text: You aim the entire ship's array of weapons and fire at will on Stonewall's spot. It's a pretty brutal display, but the mighty titan of a creature is swiftly terminated under the barrage of your weaponry, and the Rock soldiers are sent into chaos. A large horde of onlookers, witnessing your brave execution of their long-time brutal dictator, have been pushed to revolt, and they are stampeding to take down the soldiers.

It's a violent fight, and there's heavy casualties on both sides, but with your menacing automated cruiser looming above, you help sway the tide in the civilians' favor. Once the battle is for certain over, the civilians thank you for your help. Most march on to take control of Stonewall's palace, but one Rock, a Crusader who turned on his masters, stays behind. "You have done us a considerable service, and I cannot let this go without thanks. Our kind may finally be free from this oppression, and this could very well be the start. I want to stay behind and keep fighting, but I also know a Federation ship passing through here with such a powerful loadout has a very important mission awaiting them, and they can use all of the manpower they can get."

Hopefully this newfound spark of hope you've started among the Rock people won't be smothered by the reinforcements the other Elders are bound to send. You can't risk your mission any further, so you power up the engines and fly away from the city.
